Name: Mary Watson
Notes: one of the first two female chemistry students at the University of Oxford

Name: Margaret Seward
Notes: one of the first two female chemistry students at the University of Oxford; signed the 1904 petition to the Chemical Society

Name: Vera Bogdanovskaia
Notes: one of the first female Russian chemists

Name: Gerty Cori
Notes: Jewish Czech-American biochemist who was the first American to win a Nobel Prize in science

Name: Margot Dorenfeldt
Notes: First woman to graduate from Norwegian Institute of Technology

Name: Ida Freund
Notes: first woman to be a university chemistry lecturer in the United Kingdom

Name: Ellen Gleditsch
Notes: Norwegian radiochemist; Norway's second female professor
Swedish mineral chemist, first formally educated female Swedish chemist

Name: Edith Humphrey
Notes: Inorganic chemist, probably the first British woman to gain a doctorate in chemistry

Name: Julia Lermontova
Notes: Russian chemist, first Russian female doctorate in chemistry

Name: Rachel Lloyd
Notes: First American female to earn a doctorate in chemistry, first regularly admitted female member of the American Chemical Society, studied sugar beets

Name: Clara Immerwahr
Notes: First woman to get her doctorate in chemistry in Germany

Name: Fanny Rysan Mulford Hitchcock
Notes: one of thirteen (American) women to graduate with a degree in chemistry in the 1800s, and the first to graduate with a doctorate in philosophy of chemistry. Her areas of focus were in entomology, fish osteology, and plant pathology.
Polish-French physicist and chemist (discoverer of polonium and radium, pioneer in radiology); Nobel laureate in physics 1903, and in chemistry 1911

Name: Gertrude B. Elion
Notes: American biochemist (Nobel prize in Physiology or Medicine 1988 for drug development)

Name: Gunda I. Georg
Notes: German-trained medicinal chemist,professor of medicinal chemistry in the US,

Name: Remziye Hisar
Notes: Turkish chemist, first woman chemist of Turkey

Name: Dorothy Crowfoot Hodgkin
Notes: British crystallographer, Nobel prize in chemistry 1964
French chemist and nuclear physicist, Nobel Prize in Chemistry 1935

Name: Teresa Kowalska
Notes: Polish chemist, co-founder of Acta Chromatographia

Name: Yvonne Connolly Martin
Notes: American physical biochemist working on cheminformatics and computer-aided drug design in the US
Tags: Engineering, Chemistry, Biology, Physics, Computer Science, Materials Science

Name: Marie Marynard Daly
Notes: First African American woman to earn her PhD in the United States

Name: Sibyl Martha Rock
Notes: American pioneer in mass spectrometry and computing

Name: Elizabeth Rona
Notes: Hungarian (naturalized American) nuclear chemist and polonium expert

Name: Ruth R. Wexler
Notes: American organic and medicinal chemist, discoverer of two marketed drugs

Name: Ada Yonath
Notes: Israeli crystallographer, Nobel prize in chemistry 2009

Name: Glaci Zancan
Notes: Brazilian biochemist, president of the Brazilian Society for the Progress of the Science (SBPC) from 1999 to 2003

Name: Emily Balskus
Notes: American organic and biological chemist,and microbiologist. Recipient of the 2020 Alan T. Waterman Award for her work on understanding the chemistry of metabolic processes. Professor at Harvard University.,

Name: Clare Grey
Notes: British chemist pioneering the use of nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy to study battery technology. Name: Paula T. Hammond
Notes: American chemical engineer focussing on macromolecular design and synthesis of materials for drug delivery systems,particularly in relation to cancer,immunology

Name: Jeanne Hardy
Notes: American biophysicist and chemical biologist. Known for her work in the design of allosteric binding sites and control elements into human proteases. Professor at the University of Massachusetts.

Name: Rachel Haurwitz
Notes: American biochemist and structural biologist. Her work regards CRISPR based technologies,she is a cofounder of Caribou Biosciences,a genome editing and cell therapy development company.

Name: Katja Loos
Notes: German polymer chemist working on the design,synthesis,and characterisation of novel and sustainable polymeric materials and macromolecules. Chair of the board of the Zernike Institute for Advanced Materials. Professor at the University of Groningen.

Notes: American plant synthetic biologist working in England

Notes: materials chemist focusing on sustainable materials for energy applications. Professor at Imperial College London.

Name: Seble Wagaw
Notes: American process chemist and pharma exec

Notes: American chemical biologist and supramolecular chemist
